comments:
I'm trying to import the VXML w3c schema: http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/vxml.xsd into a new EMF model. The import fails but I get no error indication, Next and Finish buttons are disabled. The stack trace below came from a warning entry in the "Error Log" view.

I'm using org.eclipse.emf.ecore_2.2.0.v200605081806.jar. The same behavior appears in earlier versions as well.

The error seems related to a complex type restriction in a referenced schema:
(vxml-synthesis-restriction.xsd).

Jeff,

There appears to be a circularity in the schemas themselves:

$ xsd-example.bat -validate http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/vxml.xsd
--> http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/vxml.xsd
--> http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/vxml-datatypes.xsd
--> http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/vxml-attribs.xsd
Warning: URI http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/vxml-attribs.xsd Line 24 Column 5
XSD: The location 'http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd' has not been resolved
--> http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/vxml-grammar-extension.xsd
--> http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/vxml-grammar-restriction.xsd
--> http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/grammar-core.xsd
--> http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd
--> http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/vxml-synthesis-extension.xsd
Error: URI http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/vxml-synthesis-extension.xsd Line 57 Column 6
XSD: The type may not be circularly defined
--> http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/vxml-synthesis-restriction.xsd
--> http://www.w3.org/TR/voicexml20/synthesis-core.xsd

The redefinition in vxml-synthesis-extension.xsd appears to be circular because there doesn't seem to be any existing type that is being redefined so it's just seen as a circular type definition.

In any case, I've changed the XSDEcoreBuilder to not create a circular EClass even if the type definition is circular.
